author: jackfruh
body:
The mac installer is no longer code signed, I believe the last RC (RC2) was signed.

if it's not signed then mac users get an security stop message and can't install.

Savvy users may know the "right click->Open" trick, but from a security perspective, they shouldn't have to and should be able to trace the origins of the installer back to this distribution point.

comments.author: thezim
comments.body:
Agreed, it is not signed.

```bash
pkgutil --check-signature ~/Downloads/powershell-6.0.0-rc.2-osx.10.12-x64.pkg 
Package "powershell-6.0.0-rc.2-osx.10.12-x64.pkg":
   Status: signed by a certificate trusted by Mac OS X
   Certificate Chain:
    1. Developer ID Installer: Microsoft Corporation (UBF8T346G9)
       SHA1 fingerprint: 9B 6B 91 3B B1 3F 68 26 12 20 EC 72 11 F0 F2 0E 92 E4 B1 EB
       -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    2. Developer ID Certification Authority
       SHA1 fingerprint: 3B 16 6C 3B 7D C4 B7 51 C9 FE 2A FA B9 13 56 41 E3 88 E1 86
       -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3. Apple Root CA
       SHA1 fingerprint: 61 1E 5B 66 2C 59 3A 08 FF 58 D1 4A E2 24 52 D1 98 DF 6C 60
```

## Current
```bash
pkgutil --check-signature ~/Downloads/powershell-6.0.0-osx.10.12-x64.pkg
Package "powershell-6.0.0-osx.10.12-x64.pkg":
   Status: no signature
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: /cc @TravisEz13 Any idea? We need to make sure the 6.0.1 package is signed.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I verified it was signed.  perhaps the unsigned artifact was picked up from the build.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I discussed it with @daxian-dbw there was confusion.  The signing process for mac is complex and we picked up the unsigned file.  I'll replace it with the signed file.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The release has been updated.  A note about the old hash has been added as well.

comments.author: thezim
comments.body: @TravisEz13 are there any post build/packaging tests?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Not for mac, the build wasn't even fully automated until after `6.0.0`. This was some confusion among the maintainers.  Please file an issue.  I think all the package verification tests need to add signing verification.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I think we could add this in #3942

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I think this a new issue would be good.  That issue is already overloaded.

title: Mac installer was signed in RC, no longer signed for Final release?
